component.name: pulsar
component.title: Pulsar
component.description: Send and receive messages from/to Apache Pulsar messaging system.
component.label: messaging

authenticationClass.label: common
authenticationClass.description: The Authentication FQCN to be used while creating the client from URI

authenticationParams.label: common
authenticationParams.description: The Authentication Parameters to be used while creating the client from URI

configuration.description: Allows to pre-configure the Pulsar component with common options that the endpoints will reuse.

serviceUrl.label: common
serviceUrl.description: The Pulsar Service URL to point while creating the client from URI

ackGroupTimeMillis.label: consumer
ackGroupTimeMillis.description: Group the consumer acknowledgments for the specified time in milliseconds - defaults to 100

ackTimeoutMillis.label: consumer
ackTimeoutMillis.description: Timeout for unacknowledged messages in milliseconds - defaults to 10000

ackTimeoutRedeliveryBackoff.label: consumer
ackTimeoutRedeliveryBackoff.description: RedeliveryBackoff to use for ack timeout redelivery backoff.

allowManualAcknowledgement.label: consumer
allowManualAcknowledgement.description: Whether to allow manual message acknowledgements. If this option is enabled, then messages are not acknowledged automatically after successful route completion. Instead, an instance of PulsarMessageReceipt is stored as a header on the org.apache.camel.Exchange. Messages can then be acknowledged using PulsarMessageReceipt at any time before the ackTimeout occurs.

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

consumerName.label: consumer
consumerName.description: Name of the consumer when subscription is EXCLUSIVE

consumerNamePrefix.label: consumer
consumerNamePrefix.description: Prefix to add to consumer names when a SHARED or FAILOVER subscription is used

consumerQueueSize.label: consumer
consumerQueueSize.description: Size of the consumer queue - defaults to 10

deadLetterTopic.label: consumer
deadLetterTopic.description: Name of the topic where the messages which fail maxRedeliverCount times will be sent. Note: if not set, default topic name will be topicName-subscriptionName-DLQ

maxRedeliverCount.label: consumer
maxRedeliverCount.description: Maximum number of times that a message will be redelivered before being sent to the dead letter queue. If this value is not set, no Dead Letter Policy will be created

messageListener.label: consumer
messageListener.description: Whether to use the messageListener interface, or to receive messages using a separate thread pool

negativeAckRedeliveryBackoff.label: consumer
negativeAckRedeliveryBackoff.description: RedeliveryBackoff to use for negative ack redelivery backoff.

numberOfConsumerThreads.label: consumer
numberOfConsumerThreads.description: Number of threads to receive and handle messages when using a separate thread pool

subscriptionInitialPosition.label: consumer
subscriptionInitialPosition.description: Control the initial position in the topic of a newly created subscription. Default is latest message.

subscriptionName.label: consumer
subscriptionName.description: Name of the subscription to use

subscriptionTopicsMode.label: consumer
subscriptionTopicsMode.description: Determines to which topics this consumer should be subscribed to - Persistent, Non-Persistent, or both. Only used with pattern subscriptions.

subscriptionType.label: consumer
subscriptionType.description: Type of the subscription EXCLUSIVESHAREDFAILOVERKEY_SHARED, defaults to EXCLUSIVE

topicsPattern.label: consumer
topicsPattern.description: Whether the topic is a pattern (regular expression) that allows the consumer to subscribe to all matching topics in the namespace

pulsarMessageReceiptFactory.label: consumer,advanced
pulsarMessageReceiptFactory.description: Provide a factory to create an alternate implementation of PulsarMessageReceipt.

batcherBuilder.label: producer
batcherBuilder.description: Control batching method used by the producer.

batchingEnabled.label: producer
batchingEnabled.description: Control whether automatic batching of messages is enabled for the producer.

batchingMaxMessages.label: producer
batchingMaxMessages.description: The maximum size to batch messages.

batchingMaxPublishDelayMicros.label: producer
batchingMaxPublishDelayMicros.description: The maximum time period within which the messages sent will be batched if batchingEnabled is true.

blockIfQueueFull.label: producer
blockIfQueueFull.description: Whether to block the producing thread if pending messages queue is full or to throw a ProducerQueueIsFullError

chunkingEnabled.label: producer
chunkingEnabled.description: Control whether chunking of messages is enabled for the producer.

initialSequenceId.label: producer
initialSequenceId.description: The first message published will have a sequence Id of initialSequenceId 1.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

maxPendingMessages.label: producer
maxPendingMessages.description: Size of the pending massages queue. When the queue is full, by default, any further sends will fail unless blockIfQueueFull=true

maxPendingMessagesAcrossPartitions.label: producer
maxPendingMessagesAcrossPartitions.description: The maximum number of pending messages for partitioned topics. The maxPendingMessages value will be reduced if (number of partitions maxPendingMessages) exceeds this value. Partitioned topics have a pending message queue for each partition.

producerName.label: producer
producerName.description: Name of the producer. If unset, lets Pulsar select a unique identifier.

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.label: consumer
properties.description: The properties attached to the message.

producer_name.label: consumer
producer_name.description: The producer name who produced the message.

sequence_id.label: consumer
sequence_id.description: The sequence id associated with the message.

publish_time.label: consumer
publish_time.description: The publish time of the message.

message_id.label: consumer
message_id.description: The unique message ID associated with the message.

event_time.label: consumer
event_time.description: The event time associated with the message.

topic_name.label: consumer
topic_name.description: The topic the message was published to.

CamelPulsarProducerMessageKey.label: producer
CamelPulsarProducerMessageKey.description: The key of the message for routing policy.

CamelPulsarProducerMessageProperties.label: producer
CamelPulsarProducerMessageProperties.description: The properties of the message to add.

CamelPulsarProducerMessageEventTime.label: producer
CamelPulsarProducerMessageEventTime.description: The event time of the message message.

CamelPulsarProducerMessageDeliverAt.label: producer
CamelPulsarProducerMessageDeliverAt.description: Deliver the message only at or after the specified absolute timestamp. The timestamp is milliseconds and based on UTC (eg: System.currentTimeMillis) Note: messages are only delivered with delay when a consumer is consuming through a Shared subscription. With other subscription types, the messages will still be delivered immediately.

CamelPulsarRedeliveryCount.label: consumer
CamelPulsarRedeliveryCount.description: The message redelivery count, redelivery count maintain in pulsar broker.

persistence.description: Whether the topic is persistent or non-persistent

authenticationClass.label: common
authenticationClass.description: The Authentication FQCN to be used while creating the client from URI

authenticationParams.label: common
authenticationParams.description: The Authentication Parameters to be used while creating the client from URI

serviceUrl.label: common
serviceUrl.description: The Pulsar Service URL to point while creating the client from URI

ackGroupTimeMillis.description: Group the consumer acknowledgments for the specified time in milliseconds - defaults to 100

If this option is enabled, then messages are not acknowledged automatically after successful route completion. Instead, an instance of PulsarMessageReceipt is stored as a header on the org.apache.camel.Exchange. Messages can then be acknowledged using PulsarMessageReceipt at any time before the ackTimeout occurs.

consumerName.description: Name of the consumer when subscription is EXCLUSIVE

messageListener.description: Whether to use the messageListener interface, or to receive messages using a separate thread pool

negativeAckRedeliveryBackoff.description: RedeliveryBackoff to use for negative ack redelivery backoff.

subscriptionInitialPosition.description: Control the initial position in the topic of a newly created subscription. Default is latest message.

subscriptionName.label: consumer
subscriptionName.description: Name of the subscription to use

subscriptionTopicsMode.label: consumer
subscriptionTopicsMode.description: Determines to which topics this consumer should be subscribed to - Persistent, Non-Persistent, or both. Only used with pattern subscriptions.

subscriptionType.description: Type of the subscription EXCLUSIVESHAREDFAILOVERKEY_SHARED, defaults to EXCLUSIVE

topicsPattern.description: Whether the topic is a pattern (regular expression) that allows the consumer to subscribe to all matching topics in the namespace

bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exceptionHandler.label: consumer,advanced
exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exchangePattern.label: consumer,advanced
exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

batcherBuilder.description: Control batching method used by the producer.
